intro: Palicourea semirasa, commonly known as the pink-flowered palicourea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy surface. Palicourea semirasa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
